get that in the winter, they feed on moss, the top of the 
willows and the tender branches of the pine trees. They are 
able to bear all the severity of an arctic winter, the large 
quantity of dung observed by M<sup>r<\sup> Hearne on the snow at the 
mouth of the Coppermine proving that the locality had 
been inhabited by them during the winter of 1770-1, generally 
however in common with the caribou and other arctic 
Mammals its migrations are regulated by the season and it 
does not remain in the same place throughout the year. It 
is not found in Greenland or Spitzbergen.
